meanings.definition: To adopt or accept something before it is officially adopted.
meanings.sent1: The family was preadopting a rescue dog before the paperwork was finalized.
meanings.sent2: She preadopts new technology trends to stay ahead in her industry.
meanings.sent3: The company was preadopting a 'bring your pet to work' policy, causing excitement among employees.
meanings.sent4: His preadopting of a positive mindset helped him overcome challenges with ease.
meanings.sent5: By preadopting healthy habits, she was able to improve her overall well-being.

meanings.definition: The act of considering or planning to adopt something in the future.
meanings.sent1: Their preadopting of a child from overseas was a long and thoughtful process.
meanings.sent2: The preadopting of a new policy required input from all team members.
meanings.sent3: The preadopting of a new company mascot sparked creative ideas among the staff.
meanings.sent4: Her preadopting of a minimalist lifestyle led to a clutter-free home.
meanings.sent5: The preadopting of sustainable practices by the community helped protect the environment.
